boat.name: Laura
boat.full_description:
'Laura' was built in 1900 for Joseph Henry Atkey, of Pascall Atkey & Son, arguably the oldest Yacht Chandlery in the UK at Cowes, IoW.

Originally an open boat she was decked over in 1910. In her early days she was used to transport chandlery for the business across to Cowes from the mainland.

She was purchased by the Seabroke family during the Second World War, and remained in their custodianship until the death of Richard in 2017. She is reputed to be very fast, but has been laid up ashore since 2008.

For years she was lovingly sailed, carefully maintained and kept on a swinging mooring in Newtown, and taken ashore in 2008 yfor a refit. Time overtook her owner, who was unable to complete the work. She had been properly cradled, carefully covered and kept dry and well-ventilated. She is still very original and lacks modern electronic conveniences, but she has never been mucked about.  Her inventory is very original and includes a beautifully-made Pascal Atkey copper kettle, almost certainly one of the few left in existence.
boat.construction_details: Carvel Pitch Pine on Oak Wrought iron Floors Lead Keel
boat.short_description: 'Laura' was built for J H Atkey, of Pascall Atkey & Son, Yacht Chandlers, Isle of Wight. Originally an open boat she was decked over in 1910. In her early days she was used to transport chandlery across from the mainland.
